sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action uploads a new file on the Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Name - Name of the file to be uploaded.
  • Attachment - Attachment record or Sys ID of an attachment from the sys_attachment table which will be uploaded on Box Application.
  • Parent Folder ID - ID of the folder under which the new file will be created. If a value is not provided then the file will be created at the top level.
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which the file needs to be uploaded.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.
  • File ID - ID of the created file. Will be populated in case of success.
  • File Info - Information of the created file in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Filesb> - Information of the uploaded files.
    • ID
    • Type
    • Name
    • Description
    • Shared Link
    • Parent

    Error Messages:

    • Provided File Name or Attachment is invalid or not found.
    • Item with the same name already exists.
    • Names cannot contain non-printable ASCII, / or \, leading or trailing whitespace. The special names "." or ".." are also unsupported.
    • Parent folder with given ID not found.
    • Invalid username or password/token.
    • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
    • Provided 'As User' has insufficient permission to perform this action.
    • Account storage limit reached.
    • Unauthorized - 'As User' needs to complete email confirmation.
    • Unauthorized - 'As User' has been deactivated.
    • Invalid User ID for the given 'As User'.

    Additional Notes:

    • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.

    To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

    Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action uploads a new file on the Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Name - Name of the file to be uploaded.
  • Attachment - Attachment record or Sys ID of an attachment from the sys_attachment table which will be uploaded on Box Application.
  • Parent Folder ID - ID of the folder under which the new file will be created. If a value is not provided then the file will be created at the top level.
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which the file needs to be uploaded.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.
  • File ID - ID of the created file. Will be populated in case of success.
  • File Info - Information of the created file in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Filesb> - Information of the uploaded files.
    • ID
    • Type
    • Name
    • Description
    • Shared Link
    • Parent

    Error Messages:

    • Provided File Name or Attachment is invalid or not found.
    • Item with the same name already exists.
    • Names cannot contain non-printable ASCII, / or \, leading or trailing whitespace. The special names "." or ".." are also unsupported.
    • Parent folder with given ID not found.
    • Invalid username or password/token.
    • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
    • Provided 'As User' has insufficient permission to perform this action.
    • Account storage limit reached.
    • Unauthorized - 'As User' needs to complete email confirmation.
    • Unauthorized - 'As User' has been deactivated.
    • Invalid User ID for the given 'As User'.

    Additional Notes:

    • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.

    To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

    Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
